block.p: An article in Science Times on May 4 about rare green icebergs misstated the basis for their color. The icebergs form when blocks break off Antarctic ice shelves and capsize, bringing into view frozen sea water that makes up the bottom part of the iceberg. The frozen sea water has a green appearance -- not yellow -- because it contains dissolved yellowish-brown organic material. Pure ice appears blue, and the presence of the organic material shifts the color to green.
